part.Name: Description
part.Short: A pale shadow of a machine stares out at the world through a flickering lens set into a cranium of beaten chrome. This overlarge head is fixed to an abdomen of slim metal struts and arterial wiring, and flanked by a pair of halogen lamps. It's voice projects through a mesh larynx, ceaselessly humming a song just below the audible frequency. It hovers in the air, propelled by some unseen device; and, every so often, it's form shimmers as though it were the image of a minor moon reflected on the surface of a still pond. Perhaps that is why it seems so curious about everything, why it drinks in every detail: It's on the other side of a window - Able to look, but never to touch.
